content:
Classic problem, nicely stated.
The result of validator 4 is significantly higher than the corresponding test (as matrices dimensions are around 10 times larger), but I guess it's ok as all intermediate results remain below 2^30 (so that there should be no overflow related to V4 only).

Thanks!
Actually, the worst case is 100x2000^3 with the given bounds. Multiplication counts sum up from product to product.
So no intermediate nor final result should be over 8E11, that is, far less than 2^63 which was in my mind the limit. 
Anyway, I restricted the bounds for test 4 so it shouldnâ€™t overflow.

Well I know theoretically there could have been an overflow on 32-bit integers, I simply modified my code to keep track of the max intermediate value (which was around 2.10^8 if I remember correctly) to make sure of the following: no overflow occurs on the validators that would not have previously occurred on the tests (I actually don't even care whether an overflow occurs or not, I just don't want it to occur on validators only -- because in that case people sometimes have difficulty understanding why their code is not accepted).
But anyway, there is no problem here!
(That said, as your solution is in JS, 2^63 is probably not a great limit to have in mind as JS numbers are doubles. ;-) )
